page.title: 08AYMESTREY SAND & GRAVEL PIT
page.content: During Pleistocene times the Aymestrey area was affected by the {Central Wales ice-sheet,}a part of which, the{Wye Glacier,}spread over the Herefordshire Lowland influencing the drainage, blocking gaps in the hills between Kington and Aymestrey, diverting streams and uniting them to form the present River Lugg. The gap at Mortimer's Cross was blocked by ice which extended north of Aymestrey creating a lake at Wigmore and forming a{gravel delta. { Quarrying}of this sand and gravel on a commercial scale has been carried out at Aymestrey for 33 years, now by Amey Roadstone Corporation. The workings cover 84 acres and extraction is expected to end about 1990. 9 men are employed in the quarry itself, transport being provided mainly by private contractors.
